intro: Horkelia pseudocapitata, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It features basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its yellow flowers bloom in spring. Horkelia pseudocapitata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
